attributes.text: Methods to place popup like widgets to other widgets, points, mouse event coordinates, etc.
Returns the given always visible element. See {@link #setVisibleElement} for more details.
The given widget.
The widget which should always be visible.
Set the always visible element. If an element is set, the {@link #moveTo} method takes care of every move and tries not to cover the given element with a movable widget like a popup or context menu.
Removes all resources allocated by the last run of placeToWidget with liveupdate=true
This function will be called with the size as first argument

Get the size of the object to place. The callback will be called with the size as first argument. This methods works asynchronously.

The size of the object to place is the size of the widget. If a widget including this mixin needs a different size it can implement the method _computePlacementSize, which returns the size.
Location of the object to align the this to. This map should have the keys left, top, right and bottom.
Internal method to read specific this properties and apply the results to the this afterwards.
Returns the placement offsets as a map
The placement offsets

Returns the (computed) value of the property domMove.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #domMove}.
(Computed) value of domMove.
Any widget

Returns the location data like {qx.bom.element.Location#get} does, but does not rely on DOM elements coordinates to be rendered. Instead, this method works with the available layout data available in the moment when it is executed. This works best when called in some type of resize or move event which are supported by all widgets out of the box.
Returns a map with left, top, right and bottom which contains the distance of the widget relative coords the document.

Initial value for property domMove.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property domMove with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #domMove}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property domMove equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #domMove}.
Whether the property equals true.
The left position
The top position

Sets the position. Uses low-level, high-performance DOM methods when the property {@link #domMove} is enabled. Checks if a always visible element is set and moves the widget to not overlay the always visible widget if possible. The algorithm tries to move the widget as far left as necessary but not of the screen. ({@link #setVisibleElement})
DOM element to align to
Flag indicating if the position of the widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
Places the widget to any (rendered) DOM element.
Mouse event to align to
Places the widget to the mouse cursor position.
Coordinate of any point with the keys left and top.
Places the widget in relation to the given point
Target coords align coords
Flag indicating if the position of the widget should be checked and corrected automatically.
Places the widget to another (at least laid out) widget. The DOM element is not needed, but the bounds are needed to compute the location of the widget to align to.

Resets the user value of the property domMove.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #domMove}.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property domMove.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #domMove}.
the new value
Whether the widget should moved using DOM methods.
Offsets in one group
Bottom offset of the mouse pointer (in pixel)
Left offset of the mouse pointer (in pixel)
Right offset of the mouse pointer (in pixel)
Top offset of the mouse pointer (in pixel)

Selects the algorithm to place the widget horizontally. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.

Selects the algorithm to place the widget vertically. direct uses {@link qx.util.placement.DirectAxis}, keep-align uses {@link qx.util.placement.KeepAlignAxis} and best-fit uses {@link qx.util.placement.BestFitAxis}.
Whether the widget should be placed relative to an other widget or to the mouse cursor.

Position of the aligned object in relation to the opener.

Please note than changes to this property are only applied when re-aligning the widget.

The first part of the value is the edge to attach to. The second part the alignment of the orthogonal edge after the widget has been attached.

The default value “bottom-left” for example means that the widget should be shown directly under the given target and then should be aligned to be left edge:

+--------+
| target |
+--------+
+-------------+
|   widget    |
+-------------+
